pageTitle: Swansea City - Bodde Back In Swansea And Meets New Boss
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {12491=Costa Is Bound To Be Fit For Season Opener vs Swansea (Tuesday August 4 2015), 19718=Time: 11:09PM, 10995=Monk Pleased Despite Only Managing 1-1 Draws (Saturday July 25 2015), 11422=Thoughts Ahead of the 2015/16 Premier League Season (Friday July 31 2015), 11207=Monk Expects Gomis Return vs Deportivo La Coruna (Saturday July 25 2015), 12274=Monk: I Will Select Team Most Suited For Game Plan (Monday August 3 2015), 12060=The Observer Fans' Verdicts: 2015/16 Preview (Sunday August 2 2015), 10786=Monk Gives An Insight Into What Happens In Training (Wednesday July 22 2015), 11852=Lack of Cutting Edge A Common Theme In Pre-Season (Saturday August 1 2015), 12706=Swansea Fans 60-40 In Favour of Loaning Out Fulton (Tuesday August 4 2015), 11637=Line-Ups: FT: Swansea City 0-0 Deportivo La Coruna (Saturday August 1 2015), 22693=Ferrie Bodde was back in Swansea today, after failing to turn up on Monday and held talks with new manager Paulo Sousa. Sousa criticised the Dutch midfielder for not attending training on Monday at his request but Bodde insists that it's a simple misunderstanding between him and the club. The official site confirmed that the 27 year-old met with chairman Huw Jenkins and manager Paulo Sousa to apologise and to explain why he didn't appear on Monday. Bodde will now return to Holland to continue his rehabilitation on his knee ligament injury and will return on July 12th. His future with the club is in doubt as he has expressed a keen interest to leave and join a club in the Premiership. Bolton have recently had a bid rejected and Martinez is likely to be interested in signing him at Wigan Athletic., 19762=Date:Wednesday July 1 2009}
